alert.note: Alert for Northeast Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 26 at 2:32AM PST until November 28 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 12 inches possible in the mountains. The lower elevations will see snow amounts of 4 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Anatone, Cloverland Road, Peola, and Mountain Road. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
